It might sound strange, but the right mattress and pillow can really change your life. This is because of the impact they have on the quality of your sleep. If your spine is kept straight and your pressure points are well-cushioned, you’ll sleep deeply throughout the night. The result: you’ll wake up without aches caused by poor circulation, feeling alert, positive and ready to take on every challenge you face in the new day.

Think about your mattress

 
Its main purpose is to provide comfort for your pressure points and support your body for long periods of time, keeping your spine straight and your hips secure. If it’s not doing its job, it’s time to look for a mattress that will.
Pro tip: Let me fill you in on one of the industry’s best-kept secrets: most mattresses aren’t expected to last longer than 7 years, so don’t feel guilty about replacing your old friend if it’s seen better nights.
I recommend:
  • The Sapphire Infini mattress because of its breathable bamboo fabric and its air vents for full-body temperature control.
  • The Ultimate Curve mattress because of its superior support. It’s specially designed for heavier people so it’s strong and VERY comfortable.
  • The Heaven Classic mattress because of its specialised aloe vera fabric, lasting core support and sophisticated spring system.

Get yourself into sleep mode

 
Lots of people choose to read to relax into sleepiness (note: choose a boring book, not a good one). You’ll find you fall asleep quicker sitting up against a padded, upholstered headboard instead of uncomfortably propping your head or book up to read.
Pro tip: Try not to leave your bed when you’re sleepy because it will probably wake you up again. Keep a pair of socks, earplugs and a book handy so you can just reach over and grab them during the night.
My favourite functional bedroom furniture includes…
  • The Ivana bed frame because of its upholstered headboard and modern look.
  • The San Tropez bed frame because of its very comfortable, over-stuffed headboard and handy drawer – perfect for storing an extra blanket and other nighttime necessities.
  • The Masina bed surround because of the clever way it hides your bed base, its matching ottomans that double as bedside tables, and its matching blanket box that doubles as a bench.

Keep your airways clear

 
If you don’t get enough oxygen, your body won’t get the full benefit from your sleep. You might snore or wake up groggy or with a headache. The best way to avoid this is to reduce the allergens in your bed. Wash your bedding often and use mattress and pillow protectors to reduce the dust that irritates and clogs up your sinuses.
Pro tip: Waterproof protectors definitely have their advantages, but they aren’t good for managing your body temperature. Natural fibres like bamboo and cotton are breathable, which is best for restless sleepers.
For breathability, I recommend…
  • The Carlotta cotton mattress protector because of its allergy-friendly 100% cotton percale fabric. It has really deep sides, so it easily fits a mattress with a high box top.
  • The Maple bamboo mattress protector set because it is breathable and very soft
  • The Dreamguard mattress and pillow covers because they completely enclose your entire mattress and pillow (all sides, even the bottom) for the best protection, while also being fluid resistant and breathable!
